segments.text: I see the sink area first, with the window letting in day light.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman's dress and apron make her look so homemaker-like.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But oh, the faucet's on, and water's overflowing badly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's ruining the floor and cabinets with that mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's drying the plate, foot in the water, clueless.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Now, the kids by the counter and cabinets.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy's on the two-step stool, reaching high.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's got a plate in one hand, cookies in the other.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl's waiting patiently, arm extended.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This sneaky cookie raid is kind of adorable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Yet the stool's splayed out, ready to tip.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The contrast with the tidy garden outside is stark.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't stand the sloppiness of the water everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They need to be more careful in there.
segments.speaker: PAR
